name: nsrdude
text: A comment left by nsrdude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tegebo, magnificentpoof, SotiCoto)

name: zefiel
text: He is a robot, afterall. Maybe he's got kevlar linning under his case.

name: nsrdude
text:
Pat is just a violent psychopath. Normal well adjusted people do not hold up subway.

Vlad is like "is this goink to take lonk?"

text: "is basic mistake to be makink, holdink up a robot..."

name: radchillies
text: pat does not know that the bullets are hafink no effect on robots. Is classic mistake.

name: stuart
text:
At first I thought this comment was about Beef. I was like "Not until the end! The END!"

(Inconsequential spoilers!)

name: doc_rostov
text: The best part is that getting shot at doesn't at all rattle Vlad. He's still all smiles.

name: ted0phile
text: More 'all chins', I think.

name: krispykorn
text: i think that's just his lower lip.

name: deusoma
text: Dude's face is made of metal. I think his eyebrows are the only part of his expression that ever changes.

name: jhunt
text: Poor Roast Beef.  Dude just wanted to get his sandwich on.

name: lemin32
text: At least he got his smoke on one last time

name: saint
text: turns out Phillipe is like a reverse-Jared story...he got huge on Subway. interesting.

name: riazm
text: Thanks to this plotline I have no idea if Subway is good for you or not.

name: straw
text: I'll fill you in: it's not.

name: gmm
text: But it does taste GOOD

name: tekende
text: I don't think it's particularly un healthy, though.

name: riazm
text:
There's definitely something weirdly addictive in it though, whenever I think of Subway my mouth starts to water.

And the cheese isn't even very good.

name: cracklewater
text:
As a result of his experience, Phillipe is able to offer the best, most complete and accurate weight-loss advice there ever was.

If only he could only get Cornelius to work up "I just exercised and ate healthy" into a 200-page piece of motivational fluff, he could be richer than Ray for a few months.

name: deimosrising
text: A comment left by deimosrising was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by SSDDR, Connellingus, Darthemed)

name: dropkickpikachu
text: A comment left by dropkickpikachu was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fakead, NeoNaoNeo, SSDDR)

name: tttt
text: fact

name: apocowarg
text: Except it requires knowledge of The O.C. which is why it's all lamed up.

name: philosophe
text: not really... SNL's parody seems more well known than the its OC origins.

name: apocowarg
text: SNL's parody also makes no sense and isn't very funny if you have no knowledge of The O.C.

name: deimosrising
text: i have never watched the oc in my life, except that one five minute segment on youtube.

name: philosophe
text:
oh right no plus signs on assetbar...

plus 1

name: apocowarg
text: plus 2

name: untilyouaresonude
text: When I saw you did it to the Cornelius strip, I came looking for this one. Thank you, sir.

name: tekende
text: I don't get it.

name: chrissketch
text:
The song is "Hide and Seek" by Imogen Heap. This was used in the finale episode of the OC's second season. A character gets shot and this song plays. Saturday Night Live did a hilarious digital short where several characters shoot each other repeatedly each time, starting off that song.

And I really liked that song before hearing about that skit. As funny as it is, I hate it when songs I like get ruined as such.

name: tekende
text:
Oh!
Then I am glad I have not seen those shows, as I really love that song.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it is so good to hear it.

name: saint
text:
I MUST FIND THIS SONG. I hate being out of the loop.

"Welcome to the loop! In the next room there is a jacket with your subscriber name on it, and here is your membership card, granting you full access to all of our finest facilities!"

name: catgrl131
text: Mention our password and get the secret T.G.I. Friday's menu!

name: idsyen
text: I'm indifferent to your comment, but massive chubbies for the Officer Pup avatar.

name: gormster
text: ... what?

name: laserblade
text: Dude.  Dude that is exactly what I was thinking.  You captured the zeitgeist of me reading this comic.

name: catachresis
text: Now that Subway is over here too, I know what 7 under 6 means. HOORAY

name: nabeel84
text: Like a gun is the best way to kill a robot.

name: a_dude
text: Pat is a real DICK.

name: antsama
text: ROAST BEEF!?  NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!

name: deusoma
text: That avatar goes nicely with nearly everything you say.

name: ninjaein
text:
The more I look at it, the more I wonder if that avatar pic does everything so melodramatic:

"My toast is burnt! NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOoooooooooooooooooooo........."

name: chaesar
text: Xs for eyes lets you know he's dead.

name: zem
text: Pat is SO TERRIBLE at shooting the right person

name: parity
text:
well it seems he is a pretty good shot
he is good at shooting whoever he shoots at any rate

name: cailetshadow
text: "You've managed to kill just about everyone else, but like a poor marksman you keep, missing, the target!"

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i've blown up more than any other invader!

you've blown up all the other invaders, Zim.

name: troy_convers
text: KHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAANNNN!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: troy_convers
text: VLAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAADDD!!!!!!!!!

name: spinynorman
text: They're like oranges with Coppola

text: 7 under 6 is the best excuse I have to eat a big sandwich every now and then.

name: satellitetv
text: Never talk Philippe into going anywhere, you will be shot by Pat.

name: flynn
text: I freaked right out the first time Beef got shot.

name: joeyvig
text: This strip should be celebrated as the first to ever have a Talking Heads reference in the alt text.

name: i_love_kate
text: Good job I read through these comments before I pointed this out.

name: rowboat
text: It's hard to imagine that nothing at all could be so exciting, could be so much fun.

name: relaxing
text:
i once hosted a party where everyone left at the same time.

it was everything my byrne said it would be.

name: riazm
text:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KEpUHnvfCzQ

Here's a nice video of that song.

name: rowboat
text:
I was always really confused as to where that female backing vocal was coming from. Well, I mean I realize a recorded voice is being piped in, but I guess I could just never figure out why they would do that.

But whatever. Great song, great film.

name: tetrisattack
text: Ding Pow is my friend's last name.

name: flim
text: Hey BEEF! You got SHOT AGAIN! Why?!

name: zapatos
text: how come

name: gussiejives
text: That's gotta be one of the worst things for a five-year-old to see.

name: charchar
text: True-dat: Second-worst has to be parents making whoopee.

name: songbirdspectre
text: You *BITCH*!

name: czarcastic
text: I do love a strip that quotes Talking Heads in the alt-text.

name: dougthehead
text: Rollerskates are harbingers of death in Achewood.

name: zem
text: whoa

name: baryonyx
text: So ironic...Roast Beef unwittingly ushered in his own demise in this one.

name: zapatos
text: Onyxly though, he has Depression.  He kinda wants to go.

name: mg7810
text: Interesting theory. Like oranges in The Godfather.

name: hypoluxa
text:
Miss fat Phillipe.

He was the besssst.

name: lahnnabell
text:
When you go to Subway, you die.

Poor Beef.

And I love using "You BITCH" as a default insult. Short, sweet, satisfying.

name: mattylite
text: Reason 9456 why achewood is awesome: There's so many crazy diets and such, including Jared's, but Philippe sums up the simple truth about how to lose weight in panel 2.  A lesser comic would lampoon the diet industry head-on and wouldn't be funny.  Achewood has a 5-year old otter say something subtle about it in panel 2 of the strip where a main character gets shot by a bullet that ricochets off a robot sandwich artist.

name: atticusonline
text: Pat turned and shot beef...he did not shoot Vlad...or even at Vlad. Is simple misunderstandink.

name: mattylite
text: Oh shit you're right.  He even has those lines that mean his head was turning.  Reason 9456 will have to be amended.

name: atticusonline
text: Maybe make it Reason 9456.A

name: mattylite
text: Ratified.  Session adjourned.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Did Pat just shake his tic tac at Beef?

name: catgrl131
text: HEY-O!

name: nyu
text: This is probably how Ill die.

name: canusdivinus
text: Bitch is just not a term that heterosexual men use on its own. Son of a bitch, maybe. But "You BITCH" is definitely major foreshadowing.

name: pox
text: I think the relationship between Phillippe and Roast Beef is the cutest thing in existence. I am not even kidding. It's like, Phillippe is one of the few things in life that doesn't make him depressed.

name: tekende
text:
Five

Five dollar

Five dollar foot long...

name: rykan
text:
*SPOILER*

Is this the first time Roast Beef got shot?

name: mangtastic
text: No.  He got shot that other time and had wireless internet in his spine.  I think. UNLESS THAT WAS AFTER THIS and if you are reading this and I spoiled something then I am sorry.

name: waldo913
text: Anyone wanna take a stab at why the subway sign is a mirror reversal in the last panel?  Is that supposed to be the window above the sign or something? Subways around here don't have that...

name: hexjumper
text: That wall is a giant glass window; you can see it reversed because Roast Beef and Phillippe have just stepped into the Subway. If you stepped outside and looked up, it would look normal.

name: dipstikk
text: Exercising and eating healthy are rad ways to lose weight.

name: ajesteronly
text:
Also, I feel that Beef's smoking in this strip is: 1) one of the first times we've ever seen him do this in a long time, when, it would seem there were other much more "normal" times for Beef to be smoking (eg, at Haunches, on the road with Ray) and 2) (if it's true) His smoking acts as an interesting harbinger of death -- not at all dissimilar from Paul's holding-a-cigarette-out-of-step-eyes-closed-no-shoes appearance on the cover of the "Abbey Road" album. If you don't believe me, read the liner notes from "Rubber Soul".

Also, God, I hope this is true, because that makes Onstad a god of sequential art subtlety.
